comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The street name on the lamp-post at left is "5th Ave." The plaque at the corner reads "Garfield National Bank and Garfield Safe Deposit Company." This may be the corner of Fifth Avenue and 23rd Street. See NYT August 3, 1909, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E07E0DC123EE733A... GARFIELD BANK'S NEW HOME.; Magnificent Quarters in Fifth Avenue Building Opened Yesterday. "The Garfield National Bank, which had long stood on the corner of Twenty-third Street and Sixth Avenue, threw open to business yesterday its new quarters on Twenty-third Street and Fifth Avenue in the new Fifth Avenue Building. On the ground floor, with the bank, are the main offices of the Garfield Safe Deposit Company, ..."
